instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00138 - No green Light
threads.message:
Hi guys. 
Working on a 820-00138 board with liquid damage. No green light on adapter. 
Cleaned up and replaced U5110 and surrounding components.
PPBUS_G3H - 12.26v
PP3V42_G3H -  3.409v
SMC_BC_ACOK_VCC - 3.409v
SYS_ONEWIRE - 3.387v

Made sure I am using original 85w Magsafe 2 however I only get 16.73v on f7005 both sides. shouldnt it be 20v ? I am also testing with a known good magsafe board. 

U7100 - Pin 17/18 - 2.9 Ohm
U7100 - Pin 27/28 - 20.9 Ohm

Thanks.

threads.title: 820-00138 - No green Light
threads.message: Check if SMC_RESET_L is high, if yes, seems to be a bad SMC...

threads.title: 820-00138 - No green Light
threads.message: SMC not running. SMC_RESET should be high. Corrosion under SMC likely, reflow before replacing.

threads.title: 820-00138 - No green Light
threads.message: SMC_RESET is 0.006 so dead SMC. Reflowed didn't work.

threads.title: 820-00138 - No green Light
threads.message: You need 3V for smc_reset. Check where this signal is created. This doesnot mean dead SMC.

threads.title: 820-00138 - No green Light
threads.message: Corrosion on J6100, remove it. R5100 checked? Resistance to GND on SMC_RESET?
